intro: Aulomyrcia costata, commonly known as the Costate Aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a distinctive ribbed or costate appearance, giving it its scientific name. Aulomyrcia costata is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
